Package edu.greenblitz.gblib.motion

Class Localizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.greenblitz.gblib.motion.Localizer
  • public class Localizer
extends java.lang.Object
    A tool in order to calculate robot position using encoders (and optionally a gyro). Recommended to run in a different thread, at about one execution per 10 ms.

    Example 1:
    https://github.com/GreenBlitz/Deep-Space-Robot/blob/detroit/src/main/java/edu/greenblitz/knockdown/data/LocalizerRunner.java

    Example 2 (private until 2020 season competitions):
    https://github.com/GreenBlitz/Infinite-Reee-2020/blob/a1bfc27b303ceaa40902aed94c376bb87e000269/src/main/java/edu/greenblitz/bigRodika/commands/chassis/LocalizerCommand.java

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Localizer getInstance()

      • calculateMovement

        public static Point calculateMovement​(double rightDist,
                                      double leftDist,
                                      double wheelDistance,
                                      double robotAng)

      • getLocationRaw

        public Position getLocationRaw()
        Returns:
        The calculated location of the robot such that positive y is forwards, positive x is left. The 0 angle is facing positive y and increasing counter-clockwise.

      • getLocation

        public Position getLocation()
        Returns:
        The calculated location of the robot such that positive y is forwards, positive x is right. The 0 angle is facing positive y and increasing counter-clockwise.

      • configure

        public void configure​(double wheelDistance,
                      double leftDist,
                      double rightDist)
        Parameters:
        wheelDistance - The distance between the left and right wheel set
        leftDist - The meters counted on the left encoder
        rightDist - The meters counter on the right encoder

      • reset

        public void reset​(double currentLeftDistance,
                  double currentRightDistance,
                  Position newPos)
        Parameters:
        currentLeftDistance - The meters counted on the left encoder
        currentRightDistance - The meters counter on the right encoder
        newPos - The new position to set the localizer to

      • resetEncoders

        public void resetEncoders​(double currLeft,
                          double currRight)
        This keeps the same location as before, only resetting encoders. Use this when you reset your own encoders to avoid localizer jumps.
        Parameters:
        currLeft - The meters counted on the left encoder
        currRight - The meters counter on the right encoder

      • reset

        public void reset​(double currentLeftDistance,
                  double currentRightDistance)
        rests the encoders and set the location to 0, 0, 0
        Parameters:
        currentLeftDistance - The meters counted on the left encoder
        currentRightDistance - The meters counter on the right encoder

      • update

        public void update​(double currentLeftDistance,
                   double currentRightDistance)
        Angle is calculated using the encoders.
        Parameters:
        currentLeftDistance - Current left wheel distance
        currentRightDistance - Current right wheel distance

      • update

        public void update​(double currentLeftDistance,
                   double currentRightDistance,
                   double angle)
        Parameters:
        currentLeftDistance - Current left wheel distance
        currentRightDistance - Current right wheel distance
        angle - The current angle of the robot in radians, in the same coordinate system as specified in getLocation
